rComments: A slight language/cultural barrier here.  Overall, she means really well and will do her absolute best to help you succeed and learn the material.  Decision Making and Problem Solving was one of the most interesting classes I have taken at UCSC.  I admit the weekly quizzes were horrible though.  I would still recommend the class.

She gave quizzes every week that the majority of the class failed every week. For the midterm instead of giving a study guide, she gave a what NOT to study guide. Everyone did so poorly she was forced to bump everyones grade up bringing the average to a C. Everyweek we had tedious "group"homework. I hated this class and I hated her.
